stem: Determine the significance of chest tube chamber findings.
template: Continuous bubbling in the water-seal chamber indicates a(n) {{finding1}}, while intermittent bubbling in the water-seal chamber during expiration is {{finding2}}.

rationale.correct: Continuous water-seal bubbling = Leak. Intermittent bubbling (tidaling) = Normal with respirations until the lung re-expands.
rationale.incorrect: Obstruction would cause lack of tidaling (ceased oscillation).
clinicalPearls: Always keep the drainage system BELOW the level of the chest.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Continuous bubbling is NORMAL in the suction control chamber but ABNORMAL in the water-seal chamber.

answerBreakdown.label: Blank 1
answerBreakdown.content: The selection of "Air Leak" correctly completes the clinical hypothesis based on assessment cues.

answerBreakdown.label: Blank 2
answerBreakdown.content: The selection of "Normal Finding" correctly completes the clinical hypothesis based on assessment cues.
